title: Drawing, "Diana and Endymion", ca. 1650
medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and gray wash on cream laid paper on secondary paper support
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The goddess Diana is seated upon a bench at left, surrounded by companions.  She points at Endymion who stands opposite, stripped by young women.  Two additional young women stand at the center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Diana and Endymion", ca. 1650.
ca. 1650. Pen and brown ink with brush and gray wash on cream laid paper on secondary paper support. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2368.
